Vanessa & janelle were extremely helpful & nice. They had amazing customer service with a positive attitude.

I was actually impressed by this place. It's bigger than I expected and I love that it is right next to the movie theater, perfect for before or after movie cocktails.  The happy hour is excellent- $5 cocktails and $5 apps. We had the boneless chicken wings and they sure were hearty! We also had the Hawaiian pizza which was very tasty.  Yes there is cigarette smoke- it's a LV casino full of gamblers and drinkers; why is this so new to some locals? lol I've been in way smokier places...  We didn't gamble but the service was good, the servers were nice.  My boyfriend really liked the beer they brew there on site and I enjoyed the Moscow Mule on happy hour.  We will be back.

This Casino/restaurant has really fluctuated over time. Unfortunately it appears to have started another downward turn.  They are owned by the Station Casinos under the Wildfire brand name they use for all their smaller properties. If your a gambler, their exactly what you'd expect by a place the Stations owns. Their payouts aren't great (better than the strip, but that's about it) and their players club is very stingy with everything but two for one dining vouchers. If you like to play machines, you can probably fine somewhere better to play at. Just and FYI, they don't have a pit (almost none of the smaller casinos do anymore)  The biggest gambling attraction here is by far their abnormally large Sports Book for a Casino of their size. They have TVs everywhere tuned to sports and this is a great place if you like the Sports Book atmosphere but you don't want to deal with a bigger Casino. They are also pretty generous with their free drink tickets for sports betting.  They are also a brewery, and if you follow my reviews at all, you know I love craft beer. One of the few good things they have done recently is greatly expand their beer menu, which formerly was very limited. They finally added an IPA and a few other staples. Their beers, for the most part, are decent. They make a pretty good red and Hefeweizen, and their new Mexican style pepper beer is very good if you like that type of beer. On the other side, their brown ale shouldn't be called a brown. I actually thought they poured me a stout instead, but it ends up that's what they call a brown... The beer prices are pretty decent too, and during happy hour they are very well priced. There are far better breweries in town though, and any of the other ones in Henderson are superior if your looking for a good beer.  The main reason they have gone downhill though is their new menu. Their prices have sky rocketed and most of their meals are now $14, which is far too high for normal casino diner food. They also have some pub fare, like pizza and appetizers. They tried to upscale the menu a bit and I heard multiple complaints from regulars while I was there (one regular even said he was never eating there again). Their prices were just too high for what they were offering and no one had any good comments on it.  For our first experience with the new menu, we tried the fried green beans, the gyro and the new sriacha bacon peanut burger. The order of green beans was good, but ridiculously small for $8. The gyro wasn't very good and the pita bread it was on had been cooked so long it was crunchy. There was absolutely nothing special about the burger and as much as I love Sriracha, it didn't work here and overpowered any other flavors there. They took their old potato wedges off, which everyone loved, and their new fries are good, but not great. Also they were out of half the side dishes offered on the menu, so my wife got fries instead of the onion rings she wanted.  I thought about saying something about the gyro, but we were already using a two for one and one of the downsides here is the service is always slow. They understaff this place horribly and during sports the cocktail servers handle the food too if your sitting outside the restaurant. The servers are always very nice but there is only so much you can do when one server has a small casino floor and multiple tables to take care of.  If you come here for the food, you will probably be disappointed (two stars for food, one star for the new prices). I also wouldn't come here to gamble, with the exception of the Sports Betting. Really the sports and beer are the only reason to come here anymore, though I would try the food again with a coupon and hope it gets better.

Waiting to see a movie at the nearby Galaxy Theater?  Don't mind having to pee during your movie?  Make use of your free time at Barley's and get yourself 32 oz. of beer for $5!  Your wallet will thank you for finding a deal, and your bladder will remind you of that deal, all 32 oz. of it, during your movie.  Barley's brews their own beers, and they have the usual offerings: a hef, amber, stout, a lager, and seasonal offerings.  They are decent, not fantastic, but they get the job done.  Service is hit or miss it seems, so order at the bar to get prompt attention.

Good food, good beer but bad service. I had to walk to the bartender to get served. She either didn't tell the waitress or the waitress just didn't show. Once we got served Appetizers took forever to come out and we didn't get our waters till we walked up to the bartender again.

I used to live right by Barleys and I would go there to watch football games, drink cheap beer, and eat cheap pizza.  On game days there pizzas were $5 and the rest of the time they are about $7.  I went back there recently because I heard they were having a Brewfest.  The Brewfest was pretty sweet and after embibing a bit I decided to grab a pizza.  Now this wasn't the best pizza I've ever had in my life but it was pretty darn good!  For the price, it was a steal.  Their beers are pretty delicious as well and they offer a sampler of them that isn't too pricey.  On gamedays this place was always jam packed but any other time I've been it was empty, which can be good or bad.  The inside is nice ad the decor seems pretty up to date.  I've always had fine service when I came.  Bottom line: not a bad place to grab some great beer and watch a game.
Great beer, friendly staff, the patrons are even friendly, nice.

What can I say not sure what size it was but either a 24 or 32 oz craft beer for $2.00 during happy hr.  Out bartender was cool.  I'm not saying be an a$$ kisser, but when we use to go here a lot, one of the bartenders was always so friendly.  Idk, maybe she was having a bad day!  We all deserve one from time to time.  I won't rush to go back there, only if were seeing a movie or just in the area.

I went to Barley's for Sunday brunch with out of town guests. We're both big microbrewery fans so I was looking forward to checking out Barley's for the 1st time. We had kiddos with us so we went to the cafe. He ordered a custom made omelet and I ordered the El Benedicto breakfast special. We selected bloody marys and the lime & spicy pepper beer.   The server was friendly but service was awfully slow. The bloody marys were flavorful yet really small. The beer was super light almost watery and didn't have hardly any jalapeno pepper kick or salt and lime taste as the menu described. The omelet was delicious but the southwest style eggs Benedict was pretty bland and the plating was thrown together and sloppy looking. No garnish and monochromatic. Not really apetizing visually or in actuality.    As far as the kids portions for breakfast and the spaghetti and meatball kid's meal was enjoyed very much by the kids and the portions were huge. The serve ice cream with the kids meal so that was a nice little bonus that my daughter enjoyed very much.  Overall,  Barley's will not become a regular stop for food or beer.

I definitely prefer the salad bar at Barley's to Sweet Tomatoes.  The ingredients are fresh and the lettuce is crisp.  Best of all, I don't have to pay extra for my protein.  Score.  The salad dressings are good.  I have a deep, abiding love affair with garbanzo beans and black olives, and this salad bar had both.  Another score.  The service is a little.... eh.  I mean, the waiter brought me my drink and my check and that's about it.  He didn't bother to clear my plates or anything, but I guessed he just assumed he wasn't getting much of a tip anyway.  I guess that's how it works.  I think the price is very fair - $7.99 for soup, salad, pizza, and baked potatoes isn't bad at all.  I definitely filled up and felt satisfied.  I can't see myself CRAVING this place, but if I want a fresh, relatively no-frills salad, I'll be back.
This is a great place for locals and visitors. The beer is excellent and the happy hour deals are really good.

Las Vegas Brewery Stop #5  Barley's is located in Henderson, a good 15 minutes outside of Vegas. It was nice to see the area besides the strip...where actual people live and play. The bar is in the center of the casino. We sampled:  Blue Diamond Beer - lager Black Mountain Beer - dark lager Boulder Golden Hefeweizen Oktoberfest  The beer wasn't my style...all were very light bodied, due to the fact they were mostly lagers. Growlers were only $8.99 and $4.99 for refills! I wish I liked them more. This place did have charm though as a casino though. Well spread out and friendly staff.

Finding ourselves on this side of town last night, my husband and I popped in for a beer and a quick bite before our plans with the family.    Happy hour is from 3-6, and we remembered that they have pretty inexpensive beer.  Well.  Service has improved quite a lot since our last visit.  Our server was Dakota, and she was great.  She gave us recommendations, chatted, talked about the menu, and she was quick to bring our drinks and checked on us.   Last night we tried a hefeweizen for me, which was delightful, and a spicy jalapeño beer for my love, which was amazing.    Prices couldn't be better:  $3 for a 16 oz beer, $5 for pretzel bites with 2 different sauces...and then $8.99 for a 64 oz growler of the spicy beer....refills are only $5!  SOLD!  I'm glad we stopped back in.   We definitely plan to come back again, and SOON!!
if you like beer...come to this brewery.  Perfect little place to game, dine and hang out, even have a sports book.  One of my favorite places to come hangout.  Bartenders are awesome

Not bad. For $10 I got a healthy plate of Mahi Mahi with a tomato chutney garnish, green beans and potatoes. Nothin' fancy to make a big fuss about; just a decent meal. The beans were seasoned well and the fish was cooked perfectly. I dipped the potatoes in ketchup.   They have $2 drafts at random times, which is a good deal for Vegas.

We came here on a Wednesday night and ordered at the bar  1. NY steak and potato - 10 2. Mahi Mahi - 10  Used the $10 Groupon for $20 to cover the meals and left $3.   - Brewer's closed at 8pm, so we went to the bar instead.  - This place is also a Station Casino. A lot smaller scale.   - Service was very friendly.  - Initially, I wanted the prime rib, but the waitress said they were all out that night. fail.  - This place can't cook a steak. I asked for a Medium and they gave me a Rare. Manager came and said they would make another. This time I asked for Medium well hoping that it would be easier, but they gave be a tough well done! I didn't want the chef to go through the hassle and making another one.  - Ahi Ahi was bland. Add your own salt and pepper. But expected since labeled healthy choice.  - Potato was boring. I can make a better potato at the Feast buffet!  - Although the service was very good, the food was very sub par. Cooking steak should be mastered 101 for a chef

Wow!  Imagine my disappointment when I ordered the BBQ ribs. Not only were the dry and tough. All the sides were almost as bad. The cornbread muffin was dry and had dried up corn inside. The corn on the cob was so dried up it was almost translucent. Coleslaw didn't have much flavor. The baked beans had little flavor But was better than the other sides. The best part of the meal was the French fries. I'm just glad we had a coupon for buy one get one. My husband said the ribeye was good but chewy. Baked potato was really good. Green beans under cooked. Very disappointed. The staff were polite and friendly.

Barley's Brew Pub is a small café inside a casino.  At 3:30 pm on a Thursday I was the only customer.  The service was fast and friendly.  The menu is small and some of the prices are on the high side for the location, quality and ambiance.  Spaghetti with meatless sauce is $12 add 2 meatball and it's $16, the salad bar is $9, dinner entrees are about $15.  I had the turkey club sandwich which came with fries.  The sandwich was average and the fries were really good.  I wasn't offered any happy hour or daily specials menu.  I didn't find Barley's Brew Pub anything special a probably wouldn't bother to return.

BBQ buffet for only $12.99. Not bad. Meat was a little chewy and dry but the beer was cold.  Got the IPL, not that impressed. A little too hoppy for me. Everyone pretty much enjoyed their dinner.  The service was great.  Recommend the Mac and cheese.  The kids loved their boneless wings. Overall I may come back.

Disappointed.  The bar staff were super friendly and the beer pretty decent.  Regina was great.  We then went to the cafe and that's where everything went wrong.  Service was slow and uneven and the food was bland, bland, BLAND!  Hubby asked for a medium rare burger and it came well done.  My Tuscan turkey sandwich was truly disappointing.  I may be back for the bar and gaming but I will never be back for the food.

I recently came here for the Barley's Brewfest and it was well rounded. It might not have been the best selection of beers and breweries, but enough to get this lightweight glowing. I did not get to try most of the brews I had on my drink list, but I did get one. Banger Brewery did have their El Heffe beer.   The setting was outside in the front of the casino. All the conditions were in favor of the attendees; perfect 80 degree weather, cool beers flowing, and delicious food is a recipe for a fun time.   I did enjoy the BBQ available for purchase. The best items were the keilbasa and the brisket. I am hardly on this side of town, but for this BBQ I might have to change that. As I was walking around, I saw people with jugs of Barley's signature brews. It is nice to know that I can purchase my favorite beers and take them home to enjoy later.
Great food, pretty good beer by Brewmaster Bubba. Always a good time for NFL games! Love being able to drink Vegas craft beer while watching the Patriots!

Went to check out their all you can eat salad bar for lunch. 7$ is a pretty good price. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant was clean, not too many people eating there. The salad buffet is small, it includes soup and pizza. Everything was pretty average, nothing special to make me want to go back. Much rather go to Sweet Tomatoes and pay a few dollars more for more variety.
The place is clean the beer is very cold and the staff friendly!   A great place to grab a beer before you go to the movies next door!

I just moved here and this place is right down the street so I thought I would check it out. Also, I love craft beer so I wanted to try the local brewery. Boy was I disappointed. I walked in, was never even greeted. Found a spot by the bar to sit at and was ready to eat! It took about five minutes for anyone to even walk over and greet us. Not to mention they didn't even have menus with them! Asked about the beer and the server treated me like I was dumb. How did I know what they had to drink or any specials, it was my first time there! I was not impressed. After she dropped off one menu for my boyfriend and I to share she never came back. I'm talking about waiting 10 minutes to even order a drink! Outrageous! We finally walked out. I will not return that's for sure. What a disappointing experience.

I am updating my previous review to an A-OK based upon the following: Barleys Brewfest, staying in business while neighbors closed and their beer remains decent.  The signature brew is Red Rock Oktoberfest Lager.

last 2 times we've been here, they've really disappointed me.Today, my husband ordered a pizza and I ordered the tacos. 45 minuets later my tacos come out, dry with the sour cream hot and the limes hot.like they had been sitting under the heat lamp for a long time. 30 min after that as I wait for my husbands pizza to come out before I eat.I have to get up & ask waitress how much longer for it to come out, she tells me that it was accidentally taken off and it was coming out now. Wtf?really?! My tacos are cold &hard from sitting under the heat lamp, I would have rather you come to me when you brought my nasty tacos out and tell me what was going on. I would have understood, but no you avoid our table.girl, it's called communication!Then you tell us you're leaving so you don't have to help us anymore, but we see you walking around helping other customers.so sad because this was one of my favorite local spots...

"Meh. I've experienced better" just about sums up Barley's.  First of all, it looks huge from the outside, but once inside it's not really very big at all.  I do like that you can see the barrels and brewing operation.  However, the first impression of this place was NOT good.  Upon entering, we were immediately hit with a horrible sewer smell. Not appetizing, to say the least. That, combined with the smell of smoke, made it almost unbearable.  Anyhow, I ordered 2 beers while my friend found the bathroom.  Their in-house beers are pretty basic: light, dark, brown and hefe. Although there was a sign and tap that said "seasonal," I was told by the bartender that they currently weren't offering a seasonal. Weird.  Anyhow, the beer was not bad, but also not what I would consider good.  There were also some very shady characters at the bar. This is definitely not a place I am likely to return to, unfortunately.

Sports book manager that was working this Sunday was extremely rude. We were told Patriots would be on the large TV in bar. It didn't happen so 12 of us walked out, and we texted another 10 ppl not to show up. Sports book manager was very unaccommodating, not at all customer friendly, I can not belive how much of a jerk he was.

Relaxing bar atmosphere with good food and decent prices. Kind of feels like Buffalo Wild Wings. Of course there is gambling since it is also a casino. They also brew their own beer there and have a lot of different options on tap.  Check it out if you want a Buffalo Wild Wings feel but with a casino theme. I will go back to Barleys.

Attended the 15th anniversary and had a mixed experience.  How can you knock 15 cent beer, pizza and wings?  I can't, especially when the beer is pretty damned good.  Now the bad news...the service.  I was standing in line at the beer stand near the sports book.  I didn't mind waiting because they were fairly busy due to the cheap prices.  As I got to the front, I was second in line.  The guy behind me asked the guy pouring the beer a question and to my surprise the server asked him what he wanted and helped him.  The lady in front of me turned and said "I guess we wasted our time standing in line."  The other server, a blond lady finally helped us.  When it was my turn, I ordered 4 beers.  She told me that she could only give me 2.  That would be fine except that 2 out of the 3 people in front of me were served 3 each by her.  I only remember that because I was trying to figure out how to carry 4 and was watching how they carried their 3.  If the rule is 2 per customer, fine, but don't arbitrarily enforce the rules.  It made me feel discriminated against and irritated me the rest of the night.  I hadn't been in there for years but was enjoying my night.  In an instant, it turned and now I won't be back over something that could have been avoided.
Go here all the time. They placed a wrong bet because the didn't understand me. Went back 5 minutes later and they wouldn't fix it. Bunch of crap. They lost my business.

Decided to stop here for some refreshing alcoholic beverages and watch both the World Series and the Packer v Bronco game. It's a nice set up for sports with two giant screens on one wall, and various smaller screens around.  Beers were only $2 for a large Hefeweizen brewed in house. The beer wasn't bad so that's a good price for a large 24 oz mug. I did order Chicken Nachos and they were HORRIBLE. My stomach paid the price for these later.   Affiliated with Station Casinos, they have a sports book. Same as Wildfire. I'm not a big fan of Station anymore after they wiped out years of points accumulations.   Still on my quest to find a decent place to watch games and have a few beers in the new neighborhood. I like the TV set up here, but the seating isn't as comfortable.

We came in for breakfast as the sun was coming up from a hard night of karaoke and booze at Hot Shots. The service was very nice and the food was fresh. I wish they had a late night special, but my friend paid for breakfast so I can't really complain. I got the corned beef hash plate. canned corned beef, but when drunk it is SUBLIME! crispy hash browns and so on. Solid diner food at the right time of day. AAAAAAND you can smoke in the dining room!
Imperial Nut Brown Ale out today! So delicious! Nutty and hoppy... Hats off to Bubba!
Been here a couple times and the food is ok but the service time sucks . Mid week or weekend takes over an hour for two people ..

It's small and smokey. I mean you walk into a cloud of cigarette smoke. I couldn't run out of the cloud fast enough.  We moved to the other side of the casino and it wasn't as smokey. I don't think there is a non-smoking section.   Drinks aren't bad at all. I paid $8 for a double rum and coke. It was nice and stiff.  We hardly ever gamble but this time we won almost $100. Would return but only because I am in the area.
